WRITING.TITLE: My prediction for when the button hits zero:
WRITING.TEXT:
There will be a second button.
Only those who pressed the first button (excluding the filthy purples of course) will get a chance to press again.
Participants will then receive two flairs, further dividing the factions. A third button will appear, forbidding purple2s from pressing, and so on, until it is just a battle among the elite. From there, a winner shall be crowned.
Every [1.16699016 10^-8 hertz](http://www.google.com/search?btnG=1 pws=0 q=Once+in+a+blue+moon gws_rd=ssl norc=1 zx=1428293520453) it's blue.
It looks like the hair was covering a drain. The bits of muck gather in each hole of the drain cover.

I saw this forest this spring at my city's bonsai society's showcase. I talked to the women who this belongs to. This specific forest was once part of a much larger group of bonsai trees, but the owner abandoned the forest. They worked really hard to rescue it, and their efforts paid off. This forest does take massive amounts of maintenance, but the way she described it made it seem therapeutic.
I'm currently doing this. We're trying to figure it what it is.

WRITING.TITLE: If Google releases Android L tomorrow, would we get the update?
WRITING.TEXT: It's been 19 months since our phone has been released. It concerns me, but I think we'll still get it.
Ooh I'd love to see that.

WRITING.TITLE: Google Fiber will be hosting a live streaming of Google I/O this Wednesday.
Google Fiber will be hosting a live streaming of Google I/O this Wednesday.

WRITING.TEXT: No, but from what I've read, they usually don't care. I would still revert to stock Android. Make sure your bootloader is locked.

WRITING.TITLE: Use an oscilloscope to collect optical spectral data

WRITING.TEXT: I had the same problem with my Nexus 4. I haven't had that problem since I got the [Rinke Fusion]( http://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B00B7QGT6U?pc_redir=1402520181 robot_redir=1) case. If you're rooted and willing to download a custom kernel you could also try [double tapping the screen to wake]( https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=me.paranoid.touchcontrol).

I know some roms allow you to decrease the transition speed down to 0.25x. I prefer to have mine off completely.
Since you switch apps a lot I would recommend adding the "[last app](http://www.reddit.com/r/Android/comments/1fpuc7/the_killer_feature_of_aokp_for_me_that_nobody/)" button to your navigation bar. It's incredibly convenient. I don't think there are xposed modules for that though.
If you choose to try a rom I would recommend Slim Rom.
